unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) is picking up pace, with several states reporting significant progress. The Ministry of Power confirmed on 20/07/2024 that over 5 million smart meters have been installed so far, exceeding initial projections for Q2.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) is picking up pace, with several states reporting significant progress. The Ministry of Power confirmed on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four that over five million smart meters have been installed so far, exceeding initial projections for Q two.

unnormalised: Maharashtra's MSEDCL (Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd.) leads the charge, closely followed by Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL). These initiatives aim to reduce AT&C losses and improve billing efficiency for consumers. For example, a pilot project in Pune saw average billing improve by 15% post smart meter implementation, saving consumers an average of Rs. 200 per month.
normalised: Maharashtra's M S E D C L (Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited) leads the charge, closely followed by Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (U P P C L). These initiatives aim to reduce A T and C losses and improve billing efficiency for consumers. For example, a pilot project in Pune saw average billing improve by fifteen percent post smart meter implementation, saving consumers an average of rupee two hundred per month.

unnormalised: "We are committed to ensuring timely and efficient deployment of smart meters across the country," stated a spokesperson for the Ministry at a press briefing held at 11:00 hrs. on 27/07/2024. The government expects to reach 10 million installations by 31/12/2024. This move aligns with India's commitment to sustainable energy practices and enhanced grid resilience, as detailed in the recently concluded Power India Summit.
